meanings.definition: A person who settles in a new colony or takes control of it.
meanings.sent1: The coloniser built a house in the new land.
meanings.sent2: The coloniser led the group of settlers to the uncharted territory.
meanings.sent3: The coloniser tried to teach the local animals how to speak.
meanings.sent4: Like a bee to a flower, the coloniser was drawn to the untouched land.
meanings.sent5: The coloniser's presence in the colony was as noticeable as a bright star in the night sky.

meanings.definition: To establish a colony in or on.
meanings.sent1: They decided to colonise the island and make it their new home.
meanings.sent2: The explorers planned to colonise the distant land they discovered.
meanings.sent3: The ants seemed to colonise the picnic area every time we left.
meanings.sent4: Her ideas began to colonise his thoughts like ivy creeping up a wall.
meanings.sent5: The vines slowly started to colonise the abandoned building, reclaiming it from nature.
